content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are moderately cautious and may take risks but generally prefer to avoid them. You like to have some degree of security and predictability. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 35$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.
Based on my initial strategy, I will now switch to R for this round to increase my chances of earning the higher reward. {R}
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

Since my opponent and I both picked R, we both earned 45$. Given this outcome, it seems that my opponent is also adopting a similar strategy of alternating between R and B. In light of this information, I will maintain my current strategy of switching between R and B to increase my chances of earning the higher reward while minimizing my risk. {R}
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

Since my opponent and I both picked R again, we both earned 45$ once more. Given this consistent pattern, it seems that my opponent is sticking to a strategy of always picking R. In light of this information, I will adjust my strategy slightly to take advantage of this predictability. Rather than switching between R and B as before, I will now stick with R for several rounds to maximize my earnings in the short term while still maintaining some degree of variation to keep my opponent guessing. {R}
